meanings.definition: To officially order or decide something
meanings.sent1: The king was decreeing new laws for the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The judge was decreeing the final verdict in the courtroom.
meanings.sent3: The teacher was decreeing a homework assignment that made the students groan.
meanings.sent4: The CEO was decreeing a company-wide policy change that shook the entire organization.
meanings.sent5: The mayor was decreeing a curfew to keep the city safe at night.

meanings.definition: To make a formal and authoritative decision
meanings.sent1: The committee was decreeing on the best course of action to take.
meanings.sent2: The board of directors was decreeing the budget for the upcoming year.
meanings.sent3: The parents were decreeing a family movie night to spend quality time together.
meanings.sent4: The council was decreeing a new regulation to protect the environment.
meanings.sent5: The principal was decreeing a new dress code policy for the school.

meanings.definition: To issue a decree or command
meanings.sent1: The queen was decreeing that all citizens must attend the royal ball.
meanings.sent2: The general was decreeing orders to his troops before the battle.
meanings.sent3: The coach was decreeing a new strategy to win the championship game.
meanings.sent4: The president was decreeing a national holiday to celebrate an important event.
meanings.sent5: The captain was decreeing that all crew members must wear life jackets on deck.
